duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide guidance on health and safety regulations, conduct safety meetings, audits and inspections
Develop, plan and conduct training on safety standards, preventative care, and emergency action plans
Collaborate with project team to develop and oversee Safety Plans and serve as primary contact for injury and incident notification and management
Utilize digital platforms for tracking EH&S metrics and activities, and create EH&S plans and reporting documentation
Receive, track and maintain all EH&S related documentation, and identify potential risks related to operations and project execution
Participate in team meetings, maintain safety training certifications, and stay current with industry trends

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree Preferred in Environmental Health and Safety, Construction Management or related discipline, and minimum 5 years relevant experience in large scale commercial, government, or industrial sectors. CHST (Construction Health & Safety Technician) or CSP (Certified Safety Professional) Current certifications in First Aid, CPR, OSHA, 30-hour Construction Safety and Industry Standards plus familiarity with DOE 10 CFR Part 851 highly desirable
